com.playernguyen.optecoprime.managers

Class OptEcoPlayerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.playernguyen.optecoprime.managers.OptEcoPlayerManager

  • public class OptEcoPlayerManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A storage that enhances function such as add, remove, ... As a class, this class is easy to modify, manager and extensible for many features.

    Generally, this class has a map which contains persisted data inside. and control data between database and server

        @NotNull
public @NotNull OptEcoPlayer getPlayer(@NotNull
                                                @NotNull java.util.UUID uuid)
                                         throws java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException,
                                                java.lang.InterruptedException
        Get a player information object which persisted in map. Whether the data was out of date, request a new one and replace balance data.
        Parameters:
        uuid - an uuid of player
        Returns:
        a request player data
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException - causes by describeTankerAsync
        java.lang.InterruptedException - causes by describeTankerAsync

      • setPlayerBalance

        public void setPlayerBalance(@NotNull
                             @NotNull java.util.UUID uuid,
                             double balance)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Set a balance to player in both database and persist storage.
        Parameters:
        uuid - an unique id of player to set.
        balance - a new balance to set.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception when cannot receive a value in database.

      • addPlayerBalance

        public void addPlayerBalance(java.util.UUID uuid,
                             double amount)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Look up and add more balance to player account from database. Whether player not existed in database, create a new player with balance is zero and add new amount.
        Parameters:
        uuid - a unique id of that player
        amount - an amount to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception when system cannot looked up player.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - an amount is not higher than 0

      • takePlayerBalance

        public void takePlayerBalance(java.util.UUID uuid,
                              double amount)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Look up and take more balance to player account from database. Whether player not existed in database, create a new player with balance is zero and take it out.
        Parameters:
        uuid - an unique id of player
        amount - an amount to take
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception when system cannot looked up player.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - an amount is not higher than 0

      • transact

        public void transact(java.util.UUID from,
                     java.util.UUID to,
                     double amount)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Transacts from player to player (pay someone). This method will take a balance from `from` target and add this to `to` target.

        NOTE: from and to parameter must not be equaled. Otherwise throw an IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        from - a player from who
        to - a player to who
        amount - an amount to transact
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - an exception

        public boolean containsPlayer(@NotNull
                              @NotNull java.util.UUID uuid)
